flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
This is a fun way to make labels look like they're aged for specimen jars for your spooky decor or laboratory, for Halloween or whatever occasion strikes your fancy.

What you'll need:

  • Heavy card stock
  • Glue - glue stick/rubber cement/spray glue
  • Coffee - instant or leftover
  • Jars
  • Iron
  • Paper towels
  • Fonts - I got several from dafont.com
guide.introduction_rendered:
This is a fun way to make labels look like they're aged for specimen jars for your spooky decor or laboratory, for Halloween or whatever occasion strikes your fancy.

What you'll need:

  • Heavy card stock
  • Glue - glue stick/rubber cement/spray glue
  • Coffee - instant or leftover
  • Jars
  • Iron
  • Paper towels
  • Fonts - I got several from dafont.com

lines.text: Be sure to do a test page first. Some printer inks CAN handle being printed first and then going through the 'aging' process, but most don't. I know ours doesn't.
lines.text_raw: Be sure to do a test page first. Some printer inks CAN handle being printed first and then going through the 'aging' process, but most don't. I know ours doesn't.

lines.text: Ball up your paper into a tight ball. I pulled it apart and balled it again. Stick it into a coffee bath. It originally called for instant coffee and water, but I used leftover coffee. We make rocket fuel and knew it would do just fine.
lines.text_raw: Ball up your paper into a tight ball. I pulled it apart and balled it again. Stick it into a coffee bath. It originally called for instant coffee and water, but I used leftover coffee. We make rocket fuel and knew it would do just fine.

lines.text: I played with it a bit and started to smooth it out as it began to absorb the liquid. Depending on the thickness of the paper, it can stay in anywhere from about a minute to about two minutes.
lines.text_raw: I played with it a bit and started to smooth it out as it began to absorb the liquid. Depending on the thickness of the paper, it can stay in anywhere from about a minute to about two minutes.

lines.text: Once it is saturated to your desire, pull it out and let it drip for a few seconds. At this point you can hang it, lay it, or iron it between paper towels to dry. I chose the latter for expediency.
lines.text_raw: Once it is saturated to your desire, pull it out and let it drip for a few seconds. At this point you can hang it, lay it, or iron it between paper towels to dry. I chose the latter for expediency.

lines.text: Once it’s dry – and it has to be dry – set it up in the printer feed and initiate printing. The paper isn’t very flat so I made sure to stand by the printer and keep an eye on the feed.
lines.text_raw: Once it’s dry – and it has to be dry – set it up in the printer feed and initiate printing. The paper isn’t very flat so I made sure to stand by the printer and keep an eye on the feed.

lines.text: If the ink gets a little blotchy, don't worry as it adds more to the effect!
lines.text_raw: If the ink gets a little blotchy, don't worry as it adds more to the effect!

lines.text: Cut and glue to what you’re labeling. I used a glue stick for our project as several labels went on antique bottles and I needed to get them off with ease. Rubber cement and spray glue are great to use if you're not too worried about getting the labels off quickly.
lines.text_raw: Cut and glue to what you’re labeling. I used a glue stick for our project as several labels went on antique bottles and I needed to get them off with ease. Rubber cement and spray glue are great to use if you're not too worried about getting the labels off quickly.

lines.text: For any 'blood' effects on the labels, just add a drop or red food coloring. Let it soak in for a minute and gently blot off any excess.
lines.text_raw: For any 'blood' effects on the labels, just add a drop or red food coloring. Let it soak in for a minute and gently blot off any excess.

guide.summary: Aged specimen jar labels for your spooky decor.
guide.title: Aged Specimen Jar Labels
